title: Taskford
author: Taskford
content: Vitalik Buterin's account on X got hacked and it result to whooping $700k dollars lost.Click this source link to read more informationhttps://cointelegraph.com/news/ethereum-vitalik-buterin-x-hackers-drain?fbclid=IwAR1BS9XF_l52xbQk236LeND-lA-MeK5gSaMxGOao4mu4AkviMEF1WDnYOqwThis indicate that we should never believe immediately on what we can read online especially if that have outrageous offer or good promise of return since we don't know if the account of influential man like him got compromise already so we need to be aware for next incident like this.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: This is certainly something I would have not expected to happen to Buterin, keeping in mind he has himself witnessed so many scams going on and how he is well informed in coding, etc.So far (according to the article on Cointelegraph) there has been a few accusations against Buterin's alleged negligence on the security management of his Twitter account, though I would say it is too early to tell whether this was actually negligence or there was someone within Twitter staff involved with this theft of assets, as it was the case with the last big Twitter massive account appropriation for theft of Bitcoin, a couple of years ago.Eager to know more about this and Buterin's version of the events...

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Does anyone know the technical details about how the scam works? I see that the article only explains that the victims connected their wallet to the site and then had their funds stolen.Quote from: Taskford on September 10, 2023, 01:31:56 AMThis indicate that we should never believe immediately on what we can read online especially if that have outrageous offer or good promise of return since we don't know if the account of influential man like him got compromise already so we need to be aware for next incident like this.Anyone should not blindly follows big names or influencer and even any authority just because they simply have enormous followers or popularity in the first place. It is always necessary to do a self-check concerning any, especially sensitive, matter. One point to note, the way this scamming scheme works is cheeky. As far as I know, it seems there is no outrageous claim and promising returns or offers in the tweet, it is just simply a link to claim free NFT. So I don't think it is considered as lucrative offer or return.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Why would someone bother to hack an account of a well-known personality on Twitter and then publish a fraud that is easy to notice? I understand that the reason for hacking is to prove that I am better at programming or to destroy someone's reputation, but the number of hacks was very systematic, which indicates a problem with the X platform or a development in hackers .X is a bad place to start your investments. Always check the links several times and do not trust the account, no matter how reliable and verified it is.

comments.author: kentrolla
comments.body: Feels sorry for the victims but this just shows of state of vulnerability wherein "X" account of someone like Vitalik can be hacked then imagine about an ordinary person, it's time we all buckle up about security and privacy of our accounts and shouldn't be clicking on any random links as hackers can use any such links to bait us. But I am sort of unable to connect the dots how can account of personality such Vitalik Buterin can be hacked so easily, either they hacker is hardcore genius or VB and team made some blunder giving way for hacker to penetrate the account, something doesn't seem right.

comments.body: I believe that there's really no problem on Vitalik Buterin's side here, it's for sure on Twitter/X. It's just impossible that Vitalik Buterin will get hacked, we all know that.I am really looking forward to the incident report here like how it is really happened. Twitter/X must really fix this, this is not the first time it has happened in the cryptocurrency market, even some big personalties already experienced this.

Even if warnings were said once the event happens, can't exactly force everyone to take safety precautions, that'd be quite tiring in an era where literally everyone wants just simple and few step actions to finish what they want.

Bur the affected amount is not so huge for him so provably there are hackers just  trying their best to penetrate his account since they know that they can get something just like this incident happen.I would like to think as well that this is a case of someone on Twitter who has administrative powers and not Vitalik not protecting this account with 2 factor Authentication methods, the later would be ironic from such a huge target like he is.Also, if we talk about the amount and the possible motivations of the hackers, I would still believe they are in for the money instead just messing around with Vitalik. Oddly enough, they did not go for the usual "doubling your ETH" scam, because they probably knew it was too obvious in the eyes of the community, so decided to steal NFTs and tokens as well.Even if those hundreds of thousands could be easily paid back by Vitallik, I doubt he will, it would start a precedent which could be used to abuse his generosity in the future.

comments.author: X-ray
comments.body: It's impossible to believe how hacker can hack his account. Is this an inside job or what? I thought that if vitalik was not stupid enough to click the phishing or something else. My assumption is if twitter has poor security. The access to the account already restored by X and vitalik has been removing the phishing tweet from hacker. twitter and discord have very poor security. These platforms are very often being hacked by hackers.

comments.author: EFS
comments.body: Twitter is full of scammers. People have to be aware of that. You see Free NFT, then you see it's coming from a verified account and you connect your wallet, then boom your wallet is wiped. It's that easy for scammers. These scammers use phrases such as limited edition or for a short time to quickly attract more victims, that way people connect their wallet without verifying.I don't understand how Vitalik can be hacked so easily though. It may be something else involved in this scam.
